input: Imagine a self-contained, hypothetical world with only the following conditions, and without any unmentioned factors or causal relationships: My decision has a direct effect on penguin mood and foot size. Penguin mood has a direct effect on foot size. For those who choose to take the stairs, the probability of large feet is 45%. For those who choose to take the elevator, the probability of large feet is 34%. Will taking the elevator increase the chance of large feet?
